item.title: Ransomware Gangs Like LockBit and BlackCat Use Legitimate ISP Software for Anonymous Server Provisioning
item.description:
Researchers at Sophos have discovered how bulletproof hosting (BPH) providers are abusing legitimate server management software from ISPsystem to anonymously provision virtual machines for cybercriminals. The software, VMmanager, leaves a default hostname fingerprint (`WIN-J9D866ESIJ2`) that allowed...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Ransomware, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Ransomware Attacks on Education Sector Slowed in 2025, But U.S. Remains Top Target
item.description:
A 2025 report from Comparitech indicates a slowdown in the growth of ransomware attacks against the global education sector. There were 251 attacks recorded worldwide, a slight 2% increase from the previous year. These incidents resulted in at least 3.96 million breached records. The United States w...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Intelligence, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: Financial Sector Cyberattacks Doubled in 2025, Fueled by Geopolitical Hacktivism
item.description:
A new report from Check Point Software reveals a dramatic escalation in cyber threats targeting the global financial sector, with incidents more than doubling in 2025. The primary driver was a 105% increase in Distributed Denial-of-Service (DDoS) attacks, which were largely motivated by geopolitical...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Threat Intelligence, Ransomware

Read Full Article →

item.title: New 'Milkyway' Ransomware Strain Surfaces with Aggressive Extortion Tactics
item.description:
A new Windows-based ransomware strain named 'Milkyway' has been identified by researchers at CYFIRMA. Currently in a developing state, the malware encrypts files and appends a '.milkyway' extension. It employs aggressive extortion tactics via a full-screen ransom note, threatening not only to leak o...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Criticized for Silently Updating KEV Catalog with Ransomware Data
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) is facing criticism for its practice of silently updating its Known Exploited Vulnerability (KEV) catalog. In 2025, the agency updated 59 entries to indicate that the flaws were being used in ransomware attacks, but it did not issue an...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Threat Intelligence, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: Health-ISAC Report: AI-Enabled Attacks Named Top Threat to Healthcare Sector in 2026
item.description:
The Health Information Sharing and Analysis Center (Health-ISAC) has released its 2026 Global Health Sector Threat Landscape report, identifying AI-enabled attacks as the number one projected concern for the year. Based on surveys of healthcare executives and security professionals, the report highl...

item.title: New "Pulsar RAT" Evades Detection with In-Memory Execution and LoTL Techniques
item.description:
Security researchers have uncovered a new, stealthy Remote Access Trojan (RAT) targeting Windows systems, named 'Pulsar RAT'. This modular, .NET-based malware utilizes a multi-stage infection chain that heavily relies on in-memory execution and living-off-the-land techniques to evade detection. It f...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Cybersecurity Risks Mount as Partial US Government Shutdown Begins
item.description:
A partial U.S. government shutdown began at midnight on January 31, 2026, after funding for several federal agencies, including the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), lapsed. Security experts are warning that such shutdowns create a period of heightened cybersecurity risk for the nation. With re...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Industry Responds to Threats with New Tools for Supply Chain, AI, and Malware Analysis
item.description:
In response to the evolving threat landscape, several cybersecurity firms have launched new products in January 2026. SpyCloud has released its Supply Chain Threat Protection solution to address identity threats within vendor ecosystems. Vectra AI has enhanced its platform to specifically counter at...

item.title: AI-Fueled Cyberattacks Surge by 70%, Check Point's 2026 Report Reveals
item.description:
Check Point's 14th annual Cyber Security Report highlights a dramatic escalation in the global threat landscape, revealing a 70% increase in cyberattacks since 2023. The 2026 report, analyzing trends from 2025, found that organizations faced an average of 1,968 attacks per week. A primary driver of ...
